main event: A bright blue-white light was observed moving rapidly in an irregular, erratic manner over Westover AFB in Massachusetts on May 15, 1962.
interesting points: The object seemed to change direction and speed during the 5-10 minute observation period.
The object did not fit the characteristics of known natural phenomena like ball lightning.
Multiple witnesses, including a security officer and experienced pilots, reported seeing the object.
The object was described in various ways, including as a round, egg-shaped, or just a streak of light.
The report indicates that the sighting was likely of a large and brilliant meteor, though some witness accounts were considered exaggerated.
witnesses: Security officer, pilots, and control tower personnel
photographs: No photographs included in the report
